lines.text: I'm tired of looking after men, I want to be looked after...
Is that what you want from a man?
Confidence! I want a man to give me confidence, somebody to fight off the blizzards and the floods, somebody to beat off the world when it tries to swallow you up. Huh, me and my ideas.
Love is rotten when it happens like this - the hard way. But we want each other, this is the fire we have to walk through, because this is forever, Mae.
Forever?
Or until he sticks a knife in me, or you walk out.
How could I walk out?
And do the next thing, get away from here. If you have a dream, live it. If you have a hope, chase it.

[to Mae]
Jerry's the salt of the earth - but he's not the right seasoning for you.

[Peggy has just announced her engagement to Joe]
Congratulations. I'm glad you put the guy out of his misery.
Since when did you start recommending marriage?

[Sardonically]
Since I got my divorce.
That Mae is some dancer. Me, I'm like a hippo on two feet.
Yeah, MY two feet.
Get something for that headache!
Yeah, a new head.
Earl, he's one of the smartest men I know. He's in the movie business.
An actor?
No, but I bet Earl could be if he wanted to. He works at the Bijou theatre, in the projection booth.
That's your idea of being in the movie business?
Running movies, what other business would you call it?
Home is where you come when you run out of places.
Mae - what do you *really* think of me?

[coolly]
You impress me as a man who needs a new suit of clothes or a new love affair - but he doesn't know which.

[stung]
You can't make me any smaller. I happen to be pre-shrunk.
Why didn't you come home before?
Why didn't I go to China? Some things you do, some things you don't.
[Peggy watches as Mae leaves to meet Earl]

[to Peggy]
Maybe you'd like to go with her.
Maybe.
That ring on your finger - what'd you put it there for? A decoration?
She has a right to do what she wants to if she's in love.

you're just as much responsible as I am. So, that little eye is gonna roam... if what you think is Joe's alright until somethin' better comes along... honey, you better take another streetcar. Well, what's it gonna be?
[she starts to cry and hugs him tight]
[after watching the movie, Mae and Jerry are visiting Earl in the projection booth]
Like the show?
She's beautiful.
Who? That celluloid angel you just saw? They oughta cut her up a little bit - she'd look more interesting.
Cut her up?
Didn't you ever wanna cut up a beautiful dame?
No.
Jeremiah, you're a simple man.
Aren't there any more comfortable men in this world? Now they're all little and nervous like sparrows or big and worried like sick bears. Men!
Women!
Jerry! If you come any closer to me I'll smash your face in with the first thing I can lay my hands on!
You're no good!
Nobody wants kids around... they clutter up the house.
big ideas, small results.
You don't like women, do you?
Take any six of 'em - my wife included. Throw 'em up in the air. The one who sticks to the ceiling, I like.
I'm real glad you came back home Mae.
Why?
I like you - you know that.
You don't know anything about me. What kind of an animal am I? Do I have fangs? Do I purr? What jungle am I from? You don't know a thing about me.
Women, we spoil 'em in this country - too much education, too much free speech.
